author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Goa government on Thursday extended till July 15 the ban on Pramod Muthalik’s entry into the State. Muhalik is the chief of the Mangalore-based Sri Ram Sene, a rightwing Hindu outfit.

The ban was imposed in August 2014 by the then Chief Minister, Manohar Parrikar. Mr. Muthalik’s attempts to challenge the ban, even in the Supreme Court, failed.

The ban was demanded after the Ram Sene said it would set up branches in Goa.
title: Goa ban on Muthalik extended
